content:
This post shows several elements you can use in your articles.
Code blocks Plain code with language:
def greet(name: str) -> str: return f"Hello, {name}!" With a filename (Hugo allows this via highlight shortcode or code block options; here we show a comment as a label):
// utils.js export function add(a, b) { return a + b; } Image with caption Use the figure shortcode for an image and caption:
This is a caption below the image.
Table Column A Column B Column C One Two Three Alpha Beta Gamma Callout / note Use the collapse shortcode for a note or callout:
Note: Important tipThis is the content inside the collapsible note. Readers can expand it to read more.Summary You now have examples of code, images with captions, tables, and callouts. Reuse these patterns in your own posts.
summary:
This post shows several elements you can use in your articles.

Code blocks

Plain code with language:

def greet(name: str) -> str:
    return f"Hello, {name}!"

With a filename (Hugo allows this via highlight shortcode or code block options; here we show a comment as a label):

// utils.js
export function add(a, b) {
  return a + b;
}

Image with caption

Use the figure shortcode for an image and caption:

Table

Column A Column B Column C
One Two Three
Alpha Beta Gamma

Callout / note

Use the collapse shortcode for a note or callout:
title: Sample Tutorial

content:
This is a normal blog post with straightforward front matter.
No cover image, no featured flag — just title, date, description, tags, and a category. Use this as a minimal template when you don’t need extra options.

content:
Who I am Replace this with a short bio: where you’re from, what you do, and what drives you. A few sentences or a paragraph is enough.
What I write about Replace with the main topics of your blog, e.g. software engineering, cloud, AI/ML, architecture, or side projects. You can list them or write a short paragraph.
My tech stack Replace with the languages, frameworks, and tools you use most often. For example:
Languages: e.g. Go, Python, TypeScript Cloud: e.g. AWS, GCP, Terraform Other: e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL Contact Email: your@email.com (replace with your real address) GitHub: your-username LinkedIn: Your Name X (Twitter): @yourhandle Feel free to reach out for questions, collaboration, or just to say hi.
